revision.text:
{{Infobox settlement | name = {{raise|0.2em|Taixing}} | official_name = | native_name = {{lower|0.1em|{{nobold|{{lang|zh-hans|泰兴市}}}}}} | other_name = Taihing | settlement_type = [[County-level city|County-level]] & [[Sub-prefecture-level city|Sub-prefectural city]] | image_skyline = | image_caption = | image_map = | map_caption = Location of the county | pushpin_map = China Jiangsu | pushpin_label_position = left | pushpin_map_caption = Location in Jiangsu | coordinates = {{coord|32.159|N|120.029|E|region:CN-32|format=dms|display=inline,title}} | coordinates_footnotes = <ref>{{Google maps|url=https://www.google.com/maps/place/Taixing,+Taizhou,+Jiangsu/@32.1588554,120.02896,13z/data=!3m1!4b1!4m2!3m1!1s0x35b6a92a0b409c37:0x5bb1b337019b7f9 |title=Taixing|accessdate=2014-07-02}}</ref> | subdivision_type = Country | subdivision_name = People's Republic of China | subdivision_type1 = [[Provinces of China|Province]] | subdivision_name1 = [[Jiangsu]] | subdivision_type2 = [[Prefecture-level city]] | subdivision_name2 = [[Taizhou, Jiangsu|Taizhou]] | subdivision_type3 = Subdivisions | subdivision_name3 = | area_footnotes = (2008)<ref name=":0">{{Cite book|script-title=zh:江苏市县概况|last=|first=|publisher=|year=|isbn=978-7-55-373496-5|location=|pages=401–5|language=zh|trans-title=A Survey of Cities and Counties in Jiangsu|quote=|via=}}</ref> | area_total_km2 = 1172.2 | elevation_m = | population_footnotes = <ref name="2010 permanent">China 2010 Census County-by-county Statistics/{{zh|s=《中国2010年人口普查分县资料》|labels=no}}.{{in lang|zh}} Accessed 9 July 2014.</ref> | population_total = 1073921 | population_density_km2 = auto | timezone = [[China Standard Time|China Standard]] | utc_offset = +8 | postal_code_type = [[List of postal codes in China|Postal code]] | postal_code = 2254XX | website = }} '''Taixing''' ({{zh|s=泰兴 |t=泰興 |p=Tàixīng}}) is a [[county-level city]] under the administration of [[Taizhou, Jiangsu|Taizhou]], [[Jiangsu]] province, China. It is located in the Yangtze River Delta, bordering the [[prefecture-level cities]] of [[Nantong]] to the east, [[Changzhou]] to the southwest, and [[Zhenjiang]] to the west.
== History == The southern Hailin county was taken away to create Taixing in 938, it was administrated by Taizhou. It was under the jurisdiction of [[Yangzhou]] during the era of Yuan and Ming, but was transferred to [[Nantong|Tongzhou]] later.<ref name=":1">{{Cite book|script-title=zh:中国历史大辞典·历史地理卷|last=|first=|publisher=Shanghai Cishu Press|year=1996|isbn=7-5326-0299-0|volume=|location=|pages=722|language=zh|trans-title=The Great Encyclopaedia of Chinese history, Volume on Historical Geography}}</ref> It was returned to Yangzhou in 1953, and became a county-level city in 1992. It was transferred to Taizhou in 1996.<ref name=":0" />
== Notable people ==
* [[Ding Wenjiang]] (Geologist) * [[Yang Gensi]] (Soldier and war hero) * [[Lu Wenfu]] (Writer) * [[Gao Hong (footballer)|Gao Hong]] (Female soccer player) * [[Luna Yin]] (Singer)
==See also== * [[Zhong’anlun Monument|Zhong'anlun Monument]], to the victims of a ferry disaster
== References == {{Reflist|colwidth=30em}} * {{cite web |url=http://www.chempark.com.cn/enwhh/htm/1_guide01.htm |title=About Taixing |accessdate=2007-11-12 }}
